intro: Stigmaphyllon ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
